review_title: I love this game, don't get me wrong
one_reviews_text: This game is a god send for people like me who cant get around easy or dont have the cash to consistantly spend on spray paint. I bought both the Steam version [outdated but allows addon levels] and the Oculus store version. Had no issues up until I found out the Oculus version got an update that added new maps and features. Why would that be an issue? Well they locked it to the Quest headsets only. If your like myself or many others who own a Rift S, your S.O.L. saddly. I'd love to give it the five stars this game deserves but locking content to specfic headsets is a hard middle finger to the players in my eyes. Until they unlock content for all headsets, I'm sticking to my two stars and staying on Steam with my custom maps.
Love

review_title: QUEST FEATURES NOT ON RIFT S
one_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing game but its extremely unfair that quest users can get more locations, paint on multiple walls, be able to customize there character and have stencils as well as other features. I feel like what ever headset you have, people should have the same experience no matter what. It seems weird to have the same game on two different headsets with different features. I feel like a lot of games are trying to only be on quest or have more features on quest and rift s users like myself get the short end of the stick and some people can't afford both headsets or some rift s games aren't supported or can't transfer over to the quest. So I would really appreciate not just me but all rift s users if you add quest features onto the rift s version of the game. Other than that it is a really good game. Keep up the great work!
Decent game and all but add the quest features to rift s. The locations are getting boring af i need a daytime or nighttime metro where you can paint it outside  and something.
very chill, nice to relax in.

The game feels good to work with,  i prefer to do art instead of graffiti, the quick selection of colours, settings and music choices is great.
However there is a few problems:
1 - there is nothing to use as a stencil to block the spray
2 - i can only paint on 1 wall and very limited on where you can be in the world
-  -  i understand why this would be the case but it throws the immersion away 
3 -  i always see the color palatte (left hand) popping up, this should be activated by a button instead or be less sensitive 
4 -  coming back to point 2,   okay we can paint on 1 wall,  but why then cant i export my image to share or edit elsewhere ?

i mainly dropped a star because of point 4.  other art/model apps ive used allow this, so i can do 3d modeling or picture editing in another app

This game is insanely realistic and fun, It reminds me of my times, but without dirty hands and empty cans, great for practice and is a perfect game for vr that can truly not be experienced on any other platform.

review_title: Cant even play on my new quest
one_reviews_text: I bought the game for my rift s but it was a garbage headset and stoped working so i got a new vr headset and quest 2 and now i cante get the game on my quest 2 without rebuying the game or playing my link cable which upsets me and the fact that in game you can only draw on one wall ONE DA** WALL out of the map your on which is extremely dumb

This is easily the main game I use in VR. Down from seeing details of paint wet/dry and down to pressure sensitivity of cans. 

I have spent hours upon hours with the boombox playing music and having the option to come up with my own design or using the projector.

Only things that could definitely be added is:
- The update to use stencils
- Sometimes the items used to reach higher spots can glitch out and disappear completely. So having an app created to allow us to bring different items in to either replace or allow personal preference.
- Creating an Application for android and iPhone which allows us to access our artwork without having to dive into folders.

Overall, definitely my favourite VR game.

So this game is fantastic, I love every bit of this game especially as a graffiti artist. It is much cheaper than buying tons of cans and caps and doing it in real life. I recently just purchased the Oculus Quest 2, and so I went ahead and bought the quest version of the game which I have found to be much better in terms of graphics and UI. The only DOWNSIDE to that is that the quest version does not have a redo button!!!! Why would you guys not put a REDO BUTTON???? I would give this game 5 stars, but I just can't without having my beloved redo button. There is one implemented in the PCVR version but not the quest. You guys seriously need to update this because that is such an essential tool in this game. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE put a redo button in the quest version. I will rewrite my review once this has happened. Everything else is perfect.

review_title: I'm getting it and it's soooo cool!
one_reviews_text:
I just bought it for my 10 years old daughter who loves painting.  But it turned out it was too hard for her.  So instead, I gave it a try and spend a few hours then...  it's freaking cool and so much fun!  When I first saw this game, I assumed it was for just professional artists, so I didn't buy since I had no experience on any kind of drawing or painting.  But after a few days of practice and a lot of searching on youtube, I became kind of obsessed to this spray thing.  It feels so real than any VR games I've done so far, the satisfaction after finishing a paint is nothing to compare to playing just a VR game.  I finally see VR is not just about games.  

If you think you might liked drawing, painting but never had a chance to do it for real, this is your chance to find out your potential.  Maybe you are not a great artist but it could be a wonderful hobby.

UPDATE AS OF JAN 2022: The devs have left this version of the game in limbo. The Quest version has been updated with new locations and features but sadly the Rift S version of the game has been left in the dust. Very sad to see.

------------

First of all let me just say WOW this game is a lot of fun! 10/10 must buy.

I do have a few suggestions and requests.

- add a paint stick so that we can easily fill up hard to reach areas (without needing to climb on things.

- add stencils and masks . Ex a card board that i can hold for straight lines and a paint lid for circles. And maybe add a way to add tape to cover/mask out an area that I dont want to paint.

-add more environments. The current environments are fun but theres only 4 small areas and the rest are studio areas with a single wall in an empty room.
 
- add more life to the environment. A few of the areas have birds but please add either Ai walking around or doing their own graffiti in the bg (even of they’re just tracing over the same thing )
I just got the game and its really good

So ill start of by listing the pros and cons before writing an indepth review.

-Pros
Beautiful Graphics
Amazing Physics
Easy interface
Great Music too listen too
Fantastic Enviornments 
Tons of color options

-Cons
No players online 
Very limiting where you can paint
No Joystick Locomotion (Only teleportation)
Objects cant be painted or used as stencils or shapes

So to start off the graphics are very nice, but nothing to write home about. The enviornments and locations you can tag are great you can visit a roof, tag a subway, sneak in a train yard, and more. The physics of the spray paint are AMAZING, the wet paint, drips, how the paint drys, and how it sprays are on point, not to mention the customization you can do with the nozzle of your can and the WIDE variety of colors. The saving sytem is really good and very innovative. 

My main gripe is that in each location theres only one wall you can paint! Theres so many ideas I had but couldnt put to use do to the limitation of the enviornment. For example in the subway I wanted to go in the train and tag the inside but you cant, same goes for all the other locations, there are plenty of other things to paint but you just arnt allowed. I wish the game also integrated a type of stencil use with the interactable objects in the game. I wanted to use a wooden plank to make a straight line but the paint goes right through it and doesnt even paint the plank itself! Another thing that takes you out of the experience is you can only teleport. I find myself moving alot in the game, and with a limited space its hard to move effeciently, having a walking locomotion would be much better. Take the control button out and put it in the phone and make the phone the control button so the left stick could be used for that. The last thing i want to talk about is the multiplayer option, i find myself wanting to play with people on the multiplayer but NO ONES ON!

Final thoughts: The game is absolutely WONDERFUL! GET IT!
As an airbrush artist... This game rocks off the hinges!!! I WILL NEVER TIRE OF PLAYING THIS!!!! ABSOLUTE PERFECTION!!!!🤘😎🤘

This is has great graphics and I can keep myself entertained. 

I havnt tried it yet but I was thinking it would be cool if I could pick up an object and put it against the wall and spray over it using it like a stencil. The paint doesnt even have to interact with the object only the wall. For example I could pick up one of those boards and use it to paint a straight edge. Theres all sorts of garbage stuff you have for us to interact with already. That would be a cool update.  All in all its a good game
no one plays it so that makes it boring\

one of the best vr titles out there.
will forever support and reccomend to others.

Ive had an amazing time with Kingspray for many years and have had NO single crash whatsoever, or any issue of that sort. The game features SEVERAL little amazing small attentions to details, such as being able to break beer bottles, shoot basketball, and stack crates/ladders/barrels and the ability to climb on them to raise your height. 10/10 recommend for any artist, hellion, vandal, or bored person.
Very very cool App for Spraying and make some amazing Paintings

This is one of the few VR titles you can open up for ten or fifteen minutes on a regular basis to be freely creative.  It turns your gaming PC into a $2500 etch-a-sketch...which, like plum baby food, sounds like a terrible idea but is actually quite lovely.

I used to do a bit of graffiti back in the 80's and this is a great nostalgia kick.
Being able to play your own tunes is great too,a bit of old skool hip hop and electro really adds to the vibe:)
This is great at simulating spray cans,i've been really impressed with how in deph you can go.
Exellent job!

Simply an amazing Graf-simulator. Have had it since "the beginning" and it keeps on blowing my mind. Had two painters who have been painting since the 80´s try it out and they where mindblown by the game (and shaking their cans while painting)..... Now, if the PCVR version would integrate the new caps of the Quest version and .....cross my fingers..... work on a crossplay feature between systems.
It works great and every aspect of spray painting works great. Only bad thing is that there is never anyone online. I wish there were a way to play with steam users
im playing on oculus rift s and im trying tom play it but it keeps saying install i press it and it says it again awayst of £10.99 can anyone help :(
review_feedback:
That's no fun.  I've not seen that problem before.  If you could send us an email via our contact page (http://infectiousape.com/contact/) or join up with our discord (https://discord.gg/Yc2B5av) and get us some details about your system we can try to find the problem.  Let us know What version of windows you use, graphics card, cpu, ram, disk space, etc.  

Also, make sure you have some free disk space on your system just in case (it's happened to me where I ran out of disk space without realising it and started having all sorts of strange problems).

one_reviews_text: My friend and I were excited to get the game so we can make art together, but the only problem is that he's on quest while im on rift.  I couldn't find anything that says invite friend, so is there no cross platform or am I missing something.
review_feedback: Unfortunately they are not compatible.  Nearly everything on the quest build was rebuilt from scratch to get it to perform well.  We may attempt to get them working together in the future but it is not a trivial task.

one_reviews_text:
Excellent fun. Really good interface. Easy to learn. If anything I would change the use of 3D objects in the world to change height (to paint up high etc) and just have a button for it.
I'd also like the projector feature to have more opacity at max. A perfectly flat huge canvas would be nice too...  
BUT, I still give it 5 Stars. Well worth the money and loads of fun.

review_title: Really fun! Has a few minor issues

Painting feels very realistic, though I wish paint density changed with direction, meaning angling the can actually changed which end of the spray is a solid line and which end is flared. It makes it hard to effects like fire or water droplets.

If you're keen, though, join up with the discord (https://discord.gg/Yc2B5av) and let us know that you've got a quest as we'll need to find people to try out the beta when it's ready.

one_reviews_text: Game is lots of fun. It’s pretty easy to just get going and start tagging up a wall. I haven’t ran into any bugs. The radio works well. My only criticism is it’s hard to find a multiplayer lobby. There is a very active discord where you can find people to play with. I don’t believe you can crossplay with steam though. But if you got a friend it’s easy to make your own lobby. If you don’t care to much about going solo then this is a great game to get the creative juices flowing.
review_feedback: We're working on a new update to fix the Steam cross play issue, so you should have some more people to play with soon.  Keep an eye on the multiplayer channel in the discord; Some people like to start a private game but then share the code for it on the multiplayer channel.

one_reviews_text: Don't buy it. It's dead. Full of bugs and you can't play with other players that own the Steam version. Devs disappeard without saying anything. It's like this for over a year now.

Right now we're working on a new update to fix that as well as fix some issues and add a few new features.  If you can, send us over a list of the issues you're seeing we'll get the fixes into this next update.  The discord is the best place to send us issues (https://discord.gg/Yc2B5av) or send an email via our contact page (http://infectiousape.com/contact/)

one_reviews_text:
amazingly realistic and enjoyable, re-living my misspent youth. loads of cool caps and colour features to go deep with, or just hit the different levels and surfaces with a fatcap

getting lost in this game makes you improve a lot. even people who aren't that that artistic seem to really enjoy it, speaks for how well its implemented. 

10/10

Nice painting app.  Feels like your really in some back alley tagging away.  Almost thinking cops or some thug is gonna creep up on me! haha! Painitng physics is almost spot on.  The dripping effect is a bit unrealistic. If you like spray painting and want to do it safely and legal this is the game 4 u.

Pleasantly surprised by this title. It is more than just a paint program. It honestly makes you feel like you are really a graffiti artist. It can be very relaxing to listen to music on your in game cell  phone which hosts many different genre of music and is one of my favorite features of the game. You can take pictures of your artwork with you phone and save them to a gallery. Set up a projector in game that projects your files from your computer so you can use them as reference in game. I was having a blast with in the first 2 minutes of this game. Good stress release, just take to the streets and lay some paint down and see what comes out!  (and you wont even get arrested!) Artists, get this!

Great simulator, its good for people with artistic talent and people without. Definatley worth the money. if you want to create art, doodle with strangers or just throw bottles and listen to tunes... its all good

There's not more i can say that hasn't been said yet. It is great... the only thing is everytime i go into the details, my camer starts jiggling around. Anyone else had the same problems? any ideas how to rearange the sensory setup so i wont have that?
I have never written or drawn anything on a wall with a spraycan in my life, and I never intend to, yet I love this game. Its almost a therapeutic experience.

Strange how they put this beautiful mexican sceleton girl there. Don't be afraid there is better ambient themes in-game. The envoirments feel real, the aesthetic feels very underground. (I wanna live in that bunker!) Also the grafity fysics are so real you could just use it to practice real life skills. It's a blast!

A simple, clean, dirty app that really brings a unique aspect to your Oculus Rift experience - this one is not about shooting or playing games - its a quiet safe spot to explore your creativity and put your thoughts onto walls. WORTH EVERY PENNY. I am not and have never been into graffiti - but this app is more about you and less about that. GO FOR IT - step outside your box!

This is such an awesome and fun bit of software, so easy to use and very intuitive. You dont really need any tutorials as its all fairly self explanatory. At first I wondered how you could reach the top of the walls and side of the train etc. Then I realised you can move objects about and stand on them. It just makes sense and adds to the realism. I have been able to knock up a couple of great bits of art in just a few hours and they look just awesome. Im really going to try to learn the art of graffitti to really get the most from this, but even without the skills, its great fun just to mess about! This is easily my favourite oculus rift experience.

review_title: Easily the most realistic VR app
one_reviews_text:
This is one of the best realised VR apps available as far as I'm concerned. 

I can't believe how close this is to real life spraypainting. The amount of effort that's gone into modelling the paint on the wall: the way it goes on, the way the cans handle, the accuracy with which the paint dries... it's phenominal work, really.

I haven't done any graff in years but this could get me back into it. You can practice safely and for free here and go out and get your work down in meatspace. 

Well done guys, fantastic work.

i can see the potential but evidently i cant run it. robo recall and pavlov are fine but this runs at 24fps with no ability for me to dumb down the graphics to restore playable framerates. i5 6600 and a gtx960 with plenty of ram
review_feedback:
I had a word with our graphics guru.  He recommends turning off tesselation on your video card to improve performance.  Your best bet, though, is to upgrade your video card to oculus' recommended spec: gtx970.  

Kingspray was developed according to Oculus' original min spec which called for a gtx970 and that is still what they recommend.  They updated their min spec a while ago to include the gtx960 but that involves using their asynchronous space-warp technology, which sounds pretty dodgy.  Here's a link to a document about their min and recommended specs: https://www.oculus.com/blog/updating-rifts-minimum-and-recommended-spec-os-to-windows-10/?locale=en_US .  Your cpu is fine.  It'll be the gtx960 that's causing the low frame rate.  We don't have any reduced graphics settings as we are trying to make Kingspray feel as realistic as possible.

one_reviews_text: Great fun plus relaxing, grab your spray can(many choices) and graffiti away on several walls or locations to choose from. The boombox (internet radio) great addition, could not think of painting in silence. Importing of reference images with the ability to project on the surface if you desire is nice. I found teleport good, generally land up where I point at. I spent more time in this app than several others. What I like to see are a few more locations. As someone in the 3D field, the current locations are well done. Another hope is that the lab experiment rooms can be added to as well. Canvas Wall... hint, hint...
good for creativity

This game/experience has been fun for me so far. It's even fun for people who aren't all that artistic. I'd love to give it 5 stars but there are a few little things stopping that. More flexibility with undo (I know, you can't undo in real life anyway) and being able to save/share replays even over multiple sessions would be cool. The movement system is ok, but you rarely end up *exactly* where you want, it gets close though. Being able to start a spray with the can already tilted/pointed/oriented at the correct angle to the wall would be useful too, rather than starting a spray then turning it out to get a fade. More and/or custom locations would be great too. Or to be able to work on a wall in an empty space, then put your work on a wall in a scene. ******* As it is though, it's a great game/experience. It's fun to spray paint and mess around, especially since you're not breaking the law. And, think about it, this game costs less than like 3 cans and you get all the colors and cans you could ever use! haha  The vibration in the touch controller is done well while spraying too.
so fun and you can explore the map and mess around and interact with tuns of other stuff buy buy buy and you can do graffiti well done one of my favorite titles!!!

review_title: no one online......  but great concept
one_reviews_text: everything in this game is great..... except that after a while of playing alone and contemplating your works of art..... it would be great to have ppl online .... very few players

While it lacks any story it lets you express your creativity in a way not possible without breaking the law or having a place to spray. The graphics and physics are amazing, this is something that can only shine in VR.
noing like doing millions worth of damage to walls and not have to sit in a cell or have to pay for clean up. by far best tag sim out.

When I start the game I have no hands. Then if I start a level the spray can and color selector are stationary in front of me. They respond to button presses but dont track to my hand movements. This effectively makes it unplayable. Sucks because this is one of the titles I bought the Rift + touch bundle to play. If there is a fix for this that would be great.
review_feedback: Can you confirm you are running on an Oculus rift? It sounds like its not finding your vr device.

one_reviews_text: I Like IT!  Simple to use with realistic settings. The Rift however needs to be wireless in order to function better. Tripping over wires needlessly  is neither healthy, wealthy, or wise!

So, I realized two days ago I could add a reference image in the game. A+ that's awesome! Yesterday I decided to, and began working on it. Today I jumped back in that saved game, and the reference image had to be reloaded and, painstakingly re-placed on the wall. Discovering the aspect, FOV, and exact placement in the world is nearly impossible, so i would literally have to complete the project in one sitting. Unreasonable.

So, i'm just hoping at some point a patch is released to save the position of the reference in the world, the FOV, aspect. Even better would be to turn the FOV and aspect into numbers instead of a slider so the artist can write it down and type it in the next play. Then re-placing it in the world wouldn't be so bad (or impossible as I'm finding it). 

Other than that, absolutely awesome game. 5 stars from me regardless!
review_feedback: We have an update releasing soon that addresses this issue. Thanks for the 5 stars too! :)

one_reviews_text: All the fun of tagging without the jail time!
Want to play someone online kingspray?

Works extremely well. Don't look for extra frills ala Photoshop. You have control over the spray flow, but it's not as extensive as other paint apps. But it's not supposed to be extensive. It's a spray-can sim. I love it.
Bought it as one of my first vr games, good thing I did too. The spray painting is really realistic, which lets you make some pretty fantastic things.

Kingspray Graffiti sets out to do one thing and one thing only: simulate the experience of spray painting stuff. You can pick different paint cans, nozzles, locations, and lighting to tag walls either on your own or with friends. Take pictures, share them, record 360-degree image stills inside the game of your work, and listen to preset music stations, or your own tracks, while doing so.

Many people don’t realize that King Spray was actually an Xbox 360 indie game released around six years ago. This latest iteration, Kingspray Graffiti, takes the concept and expands on it in every way, as well as adding your hands into the experience. That’s the real game changer here. The social aspects of Kingspray are great as well, as you can co-exist in the same environment with up to four other other wall bombers in real-time. Collaborating on large wall art is exhilarating and the simple teleportation movement makes it easy to access far-reaching areas of a canvas, as opposed to physically trying to move around a building in real life.

The game doseny even work! when i try loading it, it just dosent load! it just crashs and i tryed reinstalling it three times still dididnt work and tryed deleteing the file and reinstalling still didint work! I do NOT recomnd this game
review_feedback:
Sorry to hear this Nickkid,

Its the first time we have heard about this happening.
Can you please let me know what machine / gfx card you are running? and if you could post us the output_log that would be super helpful.

one_reviews_text: This is a great little game, it's one of those games you want to play and relax. The only thing that I would like to see added is a way to import your own music so we can play it out of the boom box, other than that great game well worth the money, i'm sure it's better with friends!

As a VR art program in 2D this is the best I have played. Many VR art programs only give you the option of 3D which while it is amazing it is tricky for some. This is one of the first where I felt totally in control and was able to actually paint something decent. The game is also extremely well polished even if some features with the phone are a tad clunky. If I would recommend any features I would add in a method of creating cutouts where you take an image and say flood an area with a specific color or select that color and it turns the rest of the image into a stencle you can use to paint a pattern. If your in the market for an art program I highly recommend for those who are still getting the hang of VR art or want to paint in 2D.

The first time i logged on I met a guy who had just tagged the wall, he tossed his bottle off the building and logged off. That was the last time I ever seen another person. 

Bought this on steam first, and DO NOT reccomend. Had to get a rufund and bought it on here due to spawning in the floor.  Overall Its a fun game with no police to worry about.

Got it on the Vive and the Rift, It would be nice to have crossplatform support Vive + Rift and maybe the GearVR as a viewer only! Oculus Avatars sould have a "Default" Vive avatar that could be applied for Vive users...
There is no there, there when playing solo.  I can see this being entertaining with the right friends, but there are much better games out there to just hang around and BS in these days.

review_title: This is for Graffiti, not murals
one_reviews_text: If you think you're going create a lifelike mural, you're going to be dissapointed. As other's have mentioned, the blending doesn't work a realistically as it could and the paint won't take past a certain distance from the wall. That said, this a game about creating Graffiti, not murals. Graffiti is meant to have popping colors and distinct lines, not blended shading with lifelike detail. Search YouTube for speed paintings done using this app. If that's the art you want to make, you won't be dissapointed.
I love this game but there aren't that many People playing this anymore.

Got this as part of the Touch pack and weren't impressed. Colours could have blended more realistically and the angle you use the spraycan at makes no difference. It feels more like a cheap paint app with a brick background than painting.
review_feedback: Thanks for feedback, we have recently updated our painting simulation which addresses the issues, it be great to give it another try.

one_reviews_text: I know that's a bit of a boastfull comment, but to me tilt brush is fine from one angle, or if designed properly from all angles, but it doesn't descibe art in a way that we're used to. Kingspray is just a JOY, it allows you to play with color, and feel empowered and emboldened to explore without consequences. You can even design your own stencils in photoshop / illustrator, and then bring them to life in Kingspray. The possibilities are massive. As a social experience it's fun as well, with people stopping by, and marveling or augmenting what you've been working on. This comes with some risks, in that the people entering your realm could overwrite, or destroy your creation, but I wouldn't change that because the collaboration between artists is what makes this paint / app / game so unique.

The core tool here is GREAT. The realistic environments give a strong sense of relaxation and "cool" to the activity that is absent in the included "Experimental" environments that have just different wall types in a featureless void. The directional, reverbed sound of the boombox really adds to the sense of presence (but the default radio stations contain ads). I haven't tried multiplayer yet but I know that will be the biggest reason to keep playing a year from now. I'd love the option to save drawings as they appear w/o the surface as a PNG. I'd also love to see a more vertical environment with ladders or lifts to create a mural. And the option to spray on other surfaces within the environment besides the main one (doesn't have to be everything - there are just prime areas that seem like they'd be perfect and they're non-sprayable.) I have a good belief that this game isn't finished growing and adding features, and I look forward to coming back to it over and over. :)

review_title: Please Devs : Fix the tracking jumps
one_reviews_text: I love this application. It really is this type of experiences that make me love the vr (thanks devs). The only real complaint concerns the constant surges of tracking losses (which is very painful when working on details and which breaks the immersion). The devs must really fix this problem as soon as possible.

As a tech-demo this app is great. The feeling of being there and doing graffiti is very immersive. But sadly this effect only lasts a few minutes. For what this app does, it should be free. I fiddle with the UI on several occasions, like swiping the left joystick randomly around to enable undo-menu. Choosing colors is a pain. It feels like a bad approach to force you to use only what is possible in the real world. But because VR is not perfect yet, this really is distracting and not intuitive. For example there are artificial menus with realistic graffity-cans. Either there should be powerful menus or the cans should be real game objects.
I saw people teleporting up the wall to finish the upper side of their graffiti. I have no clue how they did this, can't find an option for that. So I need a lot of undo/redo for finishing things above me. Finally I stopped playing after using the "Playback" option which has a bug and leaves all undone steps in your drawing. My graffiti is a complete mess now - unrecoverable.

I think this is a game for a very small audience: grafitty enthusiasts with vr goggles. Everyone else is better off with Medium or Quill for drawing and Rec Room for immersion in my opinion.

I want to love this game so badly.  The core concept is one of the ones I immediately thought of as amazing applications of VR.  In addition, they seem to have a very strong understanding of what features people want in a graffiti simulator, with things like a boombox, a projector for reference images, and the ability to take 360 photos of your work.  However, this game is plagued by bugs and poor performance issues.  hand tracking is a little buggy, which is murder when trying to work on details.  the UI is unintuitive and sometimes just doesn't work for left handed mode.  The floodlights on the train tracks don't light anything up properly.  These are the type of problem that Kingspray is riddled with, and keep the game from being a masterwork.  Maybe they were just rushed out the door, and patches will fix all these niggling bugs.  If so, I'll update my review.  Until then, Be prepared to be frustrated by this game's inability to live up to its own potential.

This is a clean and impressive spray painting simulator. I believe comparing it to Tilt Brush or Quill is like apples and oranges, as it feels very distinct and these tools are good for different applications. If you are an artist that thinks free-form spray painting on a wall or the side of a truck sounds rad, you'll enjoy this. Hopefully we'll see even fuller features and more environments over time!
Epic. Super fun. For those that are complaining about tracking, get a 3rd tracker, and mount your front facing higher. No jitters.  Go roomscale or go home.
Low this app, amazing fun, good music and realistic to do the graffiti. Would be nice to have an undo feature. Do love the transport mode, but beginners instructions could be better.
If you ever wanted to learn how to draw graffiti this is a holodeck level tool! Amazing! Ignore the negative reviews. 6/5

review_title: Street art that won't get you arrested.
one_reviews_text: If i was as artfully inclined as some this tool would make beautiful art. For me, I get stick figures. The way the paint drips is awesome.

I really enjoy this creative app and it's only getting better since last patch. The presence is pretty high and you get the force feedback from your touch controllers. Seamless talking to fellow graffitti artist while spraying is awesome when doing multiplayer.
I love this sim/art program, but no way is it worth $15. I was actually confused when I first loaded it up. There isn't much content in it. If it were priced lower, it would be a must have.

It's a great concept, I love graffiti, but performance is quite poor. The tracking is not the best, it starts to lag pretty soon when not directly at center - can't draw higher on wall without my hand jumping around. The problem is that Undo button doesn't work so you have to correct stuff by hand. Well..
+ quite realistic - drips, paint, ...
- tracking
- undo not working and no shortcut for it

You can spend a lot of time in the game. As I was using it I could begin to develop techniques (If I do this color first and then spray this I get such and such effect). As a not IRL graffiti artist I can't speak to its realism, but it is a ton of fun!

review_title: good, but overly simplistic painting sim
one_reviews_text: This is a fun painting simulator, but the behavior of the paint is not physically driven like you would expect. For example, masking isn't an option. Also would like non-flat surfaces and more interesting environments. Sky was the limit with VR and we only got a fun 20 feet off the ground here.
Ignore the reviewers who have never done graf.  If you are even remotely into graf this is some star trek **#&$.  Just amazing. Get it. Now.

Shes still glitchy but im loving it. Mainly needs some work on the tracking. My can starts making circular motions for no aparent reason. Also please remove my virtual thumb from the camera as its ruining my shots :).

Rather buggy and shallow. Menu selection doesn't work 50% of the time, has placeholder text on the right hand in tutorial. Color options and spray strength only, no masking or anything but a flat wall.
